texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: After I was asked to create a stored procedure on a MySQL 5.0.45 installation last week, I received the following error:
texts.text: After I was asked to create a stored procedure on a MySQL 5.0.45 installation last week, I received the following error:

texts.label: code
texts.orig: ERROR 1146 at line 24: Table 'mysql.proc' doesn't exist
texts.text: ERROR 1146 at line 24: Table 'mysql.proc' doesn't exist

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: The server had the default MySQL 4.1.20 that comes with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4, and it was upgraded to MySQL 5.0.45. After the upgrade, the
texts.text: The server had the default MySQL 4.1.20 that comes with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 4, and it was upgraded to MySQL 5.0.45. After the upgrade, the

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: script wasn't run, so the privilege tables were wrong, and the special tables for procedures and triggers did not exist.
texts.text: script wasn't run, so the privilege tables were wrong, and the special tables for procedures and triggers did not exist.

texts.text: To fix the problem, I ran:

texts.label: paragraph
texts.orig: After about 20 seconds, the script completed and I was able to add a stored procedure without a problem.
texts.text: After about 20 seconds, the script completed and I was able to add a stored procedure without a problem.
